definition: variant of 逸事[yi4 shi4]
to excel/to surpass/to be scattered/variant of 逸[yi4], leisurely
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
anecdote (about historical person)/lost or apocryphal story

sentences.english: The key is to weave relevant personal anecdotes into your writing.
sentences.chinese: 關鍵是要編織有關的個人軼事到你的寫作中。

sentences.english: He told us some interesting things about the western world.
sentences.chinese: 他還告訴過我們西方國家的一些趣聞軼事。

sentences.english: With each assessment a short summary with anecdotal information is shared.
sentences.chinese: 每個評估都有一小段帶有軼事信息的摘要。

sentences.english: That little anecdote tells you a lot.
sentences.chinese: 那件小小的軼事可以告訴你許多信息。

sentences.english: Mr Ramo uses his anecdotes to make some sharp observations.
sentences.chinese: 藍默先生利用這些奇聞軼事建構出的觀察相當犀利。
不過我會給大家講一則趣聞軼事。

sentences.english: He bagged anecdotes for a dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 她爲編一部詞典蒐集軼事趣聞。

sentences.english: He departs from the text to tell an anecdote.
sentences.chinese: 他沒講課文而講了一段軼事。

sentences.english: Comb your past for anecdotes that make those points.
sentences.chinese: 爲作那些點的軼事梳頭髮你的過去。

sentences.english: But, a few anecdotical the problem that says palpability is more serious however.
sentences.chinese: 但是，一些軼事卻說明了更嚴重的問題。

sentences.english: He uses anecdotes to re-create his experience during theCivil War.
sentences.chinese: 他用那些軼事去重現他在獨立戰爭時期的經歷。

sentences.english: She departed from the text to tell an anecdote.
sentences.chinese: 她脫離課文扯到一段軼事上去了。

sentences.english: He launched into endless anecdotes about Shaw.
sentences.chinese: 他開始滔滔不絕地講起蕭伯納的軼事。

sentences.english: Read on for great recipes and the history of these classic cocktails.
sentences.chinese: 以下將爲您介紹經典款雞尾酒的酒譜及其歷史軼事。

sentences.english: To begin with, it was an anecdote he shared only with friends or new acquaintances.
sentences.chinese: 一開始，這只是跟朋友和初相識的人分享的一段軼事。

definition: lady's chamber
to comment on/commentary
old anecdote/stories passed on from former times
penetrating insight
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
textual criticism
biography/CL:篇[pian1],部[bu4]
heard/what one hears
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
Wu Cheng'en (1500-1582), author (or compiler) of novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记
to acclaim/to sing the praises of
to comment/a point by point commentary
current trends/the present situation/how things are going
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
to eulogize/to pass on praise
language/words
